item.title: Publications
item.description: Conference Proceedings Evocatio: Conjuring Bug Capabilities from a Single PoC. Zhiyuan Jiang, Shuitao Gan, Adrian Herrera, Flavio Toffalini, Lucio Romerio, Chaojing Tang, Manuel Egele, Chao Zhang, and Mathias Payer. In CCS'22: Computer and Communications Security. Seed Selection for Successful Fuzzing. Adrian Herrera, Hendra Gunadi, Shane Magrath, Michael Norrish, Mathias Payer, and Antony L. Hosking. In ISSTA'21: International Symposium on Software Testing and Analysis. Magma: A Ground-Truth Fuzzing Benchmark. Ahmad Hazimeh, Adrian Herrera, and Mathias Payer.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there! üëã My name is Adrian Herrera. I am a security researcher interested in applying program analysis techniques to reverse engineering and software security problems. This blog is mainly about those things. In addition to my day job, I am a PhD student at the Australian National University (ANU) under the supervision of Tony Hosking (ANU), Michael Norrish (ANU), and Mathias Payer (EPFL). In a previous life I worked on the S2E symbolic execution engine.
